unnormalised: **India's General Elections to be Held in 7 Phases, Commencing on 19/04/2024**
normalised: **India's General Elections to be Held in Seven Phases, Commencing on Nineteenth April Two Thousand and Twenty Four**

unnormalised: The Election Commission of India (ECI) announced the schedule for the Lok Sabha elections on 16/03/2024, setting the stage for a nationwide democratic exercise. Polling will be conducted in 7 phases, starting on 19/04/2024 and concluding on 01/06/2024. The counting of votes is slated for 04/06/2024. This announcement follows months of anticipation and preparation by political parties across the country.
normalised: The Election Commission of India (E-C-I) announced the schedule for the L-o-k S-a-b-h-a elections on sixteenth March two thousand and twenty four, setting the stage for a nationwide democratic exercise. Polling will be conducted in seven phases, starting on nineteenth April two thousand and twenty four and concluding on first June two thousand and twenty four. The counting of votes is slated for fourth June two thousand and twenty four. This announcement follows months of anticipation and preparation by political parties across the country.

unnormalised: According to sources within the ECI, the decision to conduct the elections over seven phases was made considering various factors, including logistical challenges, security concerns, and the need to ensure free and fair elections in all constituencies. The phased approach allows for the effective deployment of security forces and election officials to different regions, minimizing the potential for disruptions and ensuring the smooth conduct of the electoral process. Previous elections have also followed a multi-phase schedule.

unnormalised: The Model Code of Conduct came into effect immediately upon the announcement, placing restrictions on government policies and announcements to ensure a level playing field for all political parties. The ECI has urged all stakeholders, including political parties, candidates, and voters, to adhere to the guidelines and maintain the integrity of the electoral process. The commission has also emphasized its commitment to ensuring a violence-free election.

unnormalised: Several states, including Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, and West Bengal, will witness polling across all seven phases due to their large size and complex demographics. Other states will have staggered polling schedules, with some constituencies voting in the initial phases and others in later phases. The election process starts at 7:00 AM IST and concludes at 6:00 PM IST on the assigned days, adhering to the established protocols for electoral activities.

unnormalised: The upcoming elections are being viewed as a crucial test for the ruling NDA government, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, as well as the opposition INDIA alliance, which is seeking to challenge the BJP's dominance. With approximately 969 million registered voters, the 2024 Lok Sabha elections are expected to be the largest democratic exercise in history. The results, to be declared on 04/06/2024, will determine the composition of the 18th Lok Sabha and the future course of Indian politics for the next 5 years.
